JUDGES: Elisabeth Steiner;Erik Møse;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Julia Laffranque;Khanlar Hajiyev;Linos-Alexandre Sicilianos;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON , Mr ORG , Mr PERSON , Mr GPE , Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON , are NORP nationals and live in GPE . They were represented before the ORG by Mr NORP PERSON , PERSON E. Sadigov and PERSON PERSON PERSON , lawyers practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . The applicants who are all independent journalists or journalists who support the political opposition , decided to hold a demonstration in support of freedom of the media in GPE .

CARDINAL . By a letter sent in DATE , the applicants informed ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) of their intention to hold a demonstration in the form of a march from FAC to a small square near the Heydar FAC in GPE .

CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE the ORG authorised the applicants to organise a march from the Hazi FAC to FAC and then to assemble and continue demonstrating in FAC . The authorised time period for the demonstration was from TIME on DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicants were not satisfied with the location proposed by the ORG because it was too distant from the city centre and at the time there were road works underway around FAC , making it hard for them to hold a demonstration there .
CARDINAL . For the above reasons , and without formally notifying the ORG , the applicants changed the location of their demonstration to LOC in the city centre .

CARDINAL . On DATE a total of CARDINAL to CARDINAL journalists ( including the applicants ) holding banners with various slogans gathered at LOC and attempted to hold a demonstration . However , TIME after the demonstration began , several police cars approached the park and TIME police officers from ORG began dispersing the demonstrators .

CARDINAL . CARDINAL of the applicants , Mr PERSON , Mr ORG , Mr PERSON and Mr Shahveled Namazov , were forcibly dragged into police cars and taken to Police Station No . CARDINAL of the Sabail District Police Office . They were held in the police station for TIME but were subsequently released .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants brought an action against ORG claiming that they had been ill - treated by the police during the dispersal of the demonstration and that their rights of freedom of assembly and freedom of expression had been violated .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to admit the applicants’ civil claim as they had failed to pay the court fees in the manner and amount required by law .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected an appeal by the applicants and upheld the first - instance court ’s inadmissibility decision . ORG found that the ORG original claim had not complied with the procedural requirements of LAW concerning the form and content of civil claims , and that the applicants had failed to attach any documentary evidence in support of their claim , apart from photocopies of several photographs .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld ORG decision . ORG decision was sent to the applicants on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the application was communicated to the respondent Government . On DATE the ORG submitted a friendly - settlement proposal within the framework of the proceedings before the ORG , and on DATE the ORG sent the proposal to the applicants .
CARDINAL . At DATE , several articles were published in the NORP media concerning the Government ’s friendly - settlement proposal to the applicants . Some of the articles are described below .

CARDINAL . On DATE an article was published on the website of the PERSON newspaper . The article was accompanied by CARDINAL photographs in which all of the applicants , except Mr PERSON and PERSON GPE , are present , together with other persons . The article was entitled “ The Government Offer MONEY to CARDINAL Journalists ” ( “ LOC CARDINAL jurnalistə QUANTITY avro təklif edir ” ) and read , in its relevant part , as follows :

“ ... The current situation is that the Government are ready to pay the MONEY in compensation that the journalists claim . The respondent party is trying to prevent the adoption of a new court judgment against GPE and the examination of the case before ORG by proposing a friendly settlement to the journalists . DATE , the applicant journalists , except for PERSON [ PERSON ] and PERSON [ GPE ] , met at the office of the PERSON newspaper and assessed the current situation . The common opinion of the participants in the discussion was that in comparison with the unlawfulness to which the journalists had been subjected the amount of the proposed compensation was low . Moreover , they concentrated on CARDINAL options for reaching a final decision . The first option is a conditional agreement . Thus , in that case the applicants would accept the friendly - settlement proposal on the condition that they obtained the punishment of the court judges and police officers who had used violence against them . In that case , the Government would eradicate the causes which created this situation . The second option is for the above - mentioned case to continue before ORG until the final stage .

The journalists also stated during the discussions that if there was a decision , it would be the first decision concerning LAW in respect of GPE . This is important for democracy and free speech in GPE ...
Following this interesting discussion , the journalists decided to discuss the issue again in DATE in the presence of the director of ORG , PERSON ... ”

CARDINAL . Another article dated DATE , DATE , was published on the website of ORG . The article , entitled “ The Azerbaijani Government Propose Friendly Settlement to CARDINAL NORP ” ( “ Azərbaycan hakimiyyəti CARDINAL jurnalistə barışıq təklif edir ” ) , was written by PERSON . It was stated in the article that Mr Shahveled Namazov , CARDINAL of the applicants , had informed ORG that ORG had proposed a friendly settlement to the CARDINAL journalists that included compensation of QUANTITY . Mr ORG also stated that the journalists could not reach a consensus as some of them wanted to accept the ORG ’s proposal . He further continued as follows :

“ The common opinion was that we can not be satisfied solely with the compensation ; our right of assembly has been violated . Some of us are in favour of pursuing a judgment by ORG because such a judgment will become a precedent ” .

CARDINAL . In the same article , another applicant , Mr PERSON , was also quoted . He stated that in their claim they had requested the punishment of the police officers who had used violence against them , as well as the punishment of the judges of the first - instance court who had dismissed their action . He continued as follows :
“ However , these assurances were not secured in the proposal by ORG ; if they were secured , it would be possible to withdraw the application ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE an interview with CARDINAL of the CARDINAL representatives of the applicants before the ORG , Mr PERSON , was published on the website of ORG radio station . The article was entitled “ PERSON : ORG Decision May Positively Influence the Judicial System and Legislation of the Country ” ( “ PERSON : PERSON qərarı ölkədəki məhkəmə sisteminə və qanunvericiliyə müsbət təsir edə bilər ” ) . The relevant parts of the interview read as follows :
“ Question : Do the journalists agree with the friendly - settlement proposal ?
Answer : I , as a lawyer , informed each journalist of , and sent them , the ORG ’s proposal . They have to make clear their decision separately , as well as to decide together by discussing it .
Question : What do the Government propose ? Who are the applicant journalists ?

Answer : The applicants are the director of ORG , PERSON , the editor of the PERSON newspaper , PERSON [ GPE ] , the journalist PERSON [ PERSON ] , the editor - in - chief of the PERSON newspaper , PERSON , and reporters at that newspaper PERSON [ ORG ] , PERSON [ GPE ] , PERSON [ ORG ] and PERSON [ PERSON ] . Our claim was for MONEY for each applicant plus the payment of additional cost and expenses . The Government offered to pay the non - pecuniary damage claim in full , but did not offer to pay the court and legal costs .
Question : Would ORG adopt a judgment if there was no agreement between the journalists and the Government ?

Answer : If the applicants do not accept the ORG ’s offer , ORG will probably continue with its examination of the case . It is true that justification has to be given for why the friendly settlement was not accepted . The justification has to be accompanied by arguments . If the ORG considers that the justification is not supported by arguments , it could discontinue the case . It may strike the case out of the list and inform the applicants of the acceptance of the Government ’s proposal .

Question : The media writes that there is disagreement between the applicant journalists . Some of the applicants want to accept the ORG ’s proposal , other journalists will not accept the friendly - settlement proposal as the Government do not guarantee freedom of assembly . They seek the adoption of a judgment by ORG in order to have a judicial precedent . What do you think about this ?

Answer : Discussion of the friendly - settlement proposal in the media does not comply with the rules on confidentiality . On the other hand , if the victim journalists make the issue public , it is also their right . I have not yet received the final decision from the applicants ... ”
CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE , the applicants informed ORG of their refusal to accept the ORG ’s friendly - settlement proposal .
